alert.note: Alert for Perry (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 26 at 6:02PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Perry, Hancock, west central Breckinridge and northeastern Ohio Counties through 530 PM CDT... At 501 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles south of Whitesville, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Perry, Hancock, northeastern Ohio and west central Breckinridge Counties, including the following locations... Taffy, Skillman, Goering, Ralph, Pellville, Magan, Dodd, Tobinsport, Holt and Sunny Corner. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
